title: `could not find markdown in source` in `cargo doc` from comments in proc macro

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Invoking this proc macro and running `cargo doc` rusults in a crash the the error `could not find markdown in source`: ```rust #[proc_macro] pub fn foo(_: TokenStream) -> TokenStream { "/// https://foobar.com\npub struct Foo;".parse().unwrap() } ``` If this code were written directly rather than generated by a proc macro, this would produce `warning: this URL is not a hyperlink`. But I guess when it goes through a proc macro it can't generate correct span information for the warning and crashes. I originally noticed this with the [`schemafy::schemafy!` macro](https://docs.rs/schemafy/0.6.0/schemafy/macro.schemafy.html). ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.60.0-nightly (89b9f7b28 2022-01-10) ```
